Ill add something that no one else has said.

Use pings.

Don't expect your team to have any map awareness in silver. One ping will generally go unnoticed or largely ignored, so when something is important enough to ping, ping about 5 times at once. Work on pinging stuff that is actually important though, spamming pings every 5 seconds will likely just piss people off and they will start paying less attention to your pings. 

Good times to ping are:
-The enemy jungler, or another enemy, is walking over a ward ganking a teammate. Assume that they have not noticed (especially mid/top) since they are likely tunnel visioned on farming well or trading with the enemy.
-Your lane opponent has gone mia and is likely roaming. Using danger/retreat pings on their destination is usually more effective than just using missing pings in your own lane.
-You are roaming to another lane and going in for a gank. Ping when you are about 5 seconds away from showing in lane, because your teammates often won't have noticed you are coming. Try not to ping too far in advance or you might bait your teammate into dying before you get there.
-You, or your team elsewhere on the map, have just got several kills and you can easily turn that into a tower/dragon/baron. It is very important to turn kills into more that that if you want to actually win the game. Also note that you don't have to be in the area to secure a dragon or tower for your team, often all that is required is one guy noticing how easy it is to get and telling their team to grab it.
-A teammate is wandering off by themselves or some of your teammates are pushing as 3 or 4 vs the whole enemy team later in the game. You can't always stop people making poor decisions, but reasonably often you can.

As for actually winning, since you seem to be somewhat of a zed main, i'm going to say this, become a one trick pony, and learn how to roam, carrying the game like you are saying (you win lane and everyone elses lane) is not what you are doing with a 40-55% Kill contribution.

The literal only way anyone gets out of silver (bar paying to get boosted), is if you never blame any other player for a lost game again. Every single time you lose, instead of raging at how some stupid thing some random did lost you the game, calm down, and think about the mistakes YOU made that game. Then fix them. Fix every little mistake you can find in your own play instead of finding all the mistakes of others, and I guarantee you will begin to climb rapidly. Because as you fix your mistakes, you get better in lane, you start winning your lanes. HARD. Then you can carry extremely easily. That's the most basic thing that will get you to climb in rank.

The other thing that will make life in any rank easier is to play champions that aren't difficult, but still have massive impacts on the game. Examples: Annie, Leona, Malphite. They all have easy to hit, massive CC that even if behind, can swing teamfights massively in your favour and if ahead, literally just snowball your team out of control. Examples of champions to avoid: Lee Sin, Yasuo, Kalista, VAYNE. Any champion that requires either very good positioning, overall mechanics or hitting skillshots to set up combos that have big impacts are simply going to get you destroyed in lower ranks, and not always because of a lack of skill of the person playing them, its the fact that you're in a lower tier of play, people simply don't react as quickly and correctly to complex plays. The more simple things are, the less skill is required to pull something off, the higher chance it has of working. Simple really. 

tl;dr
Stop caring about what other people screw up +
Find and fix your own mistakes +
Play simple champions with big impacts +
Avoid difficult champions +
= climb
